Granting Access Rights at the Folder Level

Many administrators set access rights only for projects and views. They avoid setting folder-level access rights for the root folder of a view or project, because these rights can interfere with certain operations, such as opening a project or view.

It is best to set folder-level access rights for particular branches only. For example, you may want to do this to allow specific groups to access a particular branch of the folder hierarchy.

When a child view is derived from a parent view, it generally contains objects that belong to its parent. In a branching view, these objects can then branch into new objects that exist only in the child view. Folders and items retain the access rights they had in the parent view until they branch into new objects in the child view.

The Folder Access Rights dialog has two folder nodes: This Folder and Child Folders. These nodes allow you to set different access rights for the selected folder (This Folder) and for other folders (Child Folders) in the folder hierarchy of its branch.

Note: Because This Folder has no generic item container subcategory for access rights, container rights for This Folder are set in the Child Folders node for the parent folder. If This Folder is the root folder, the rights are set at the View level using the Child Folders node.

To set folder access rights:

  1. Select the folder.

  2. Select Folder > Advanced > Access  Rights from the StarTeam client menu. This action displays a Folder Access Rights dialog.

  3. Select the This Folder node. It is best to start at the top and work down.

  4. From the Access Rights dialog, click Add to add a user or group. The Assign Access Rights To dialog opens.

  5. Select a user or group. Users are listed by their user names and groups are listed by their position in the group hierarchy, except for the All Users group.

  6. Select the Grant option button. Note: Never select the Deny option button unless you are creating an exception. See Setting Access Rights Exceptions.

  7. Click OK to return to the Folder Access Rights dialog.

  8. Select and/or clear the appropriate check boxes for the user or group.

  9. Select the Child Folders node and repeat steps 4-8, if required

  10. Click OK when you are done.

This Folder Access Rights

See item and its properties

See this folder in the application folder hierarchy (left pane). View the Name, Exclude, and Files tabs on the Folder Properties dialog for this folder.

See history

See the folder’s History tab on the Folder Properties dialog.

See links

See the folder's links on the Links tab of the Folder Properties dialog.

Modify properties

Change the folder properties on the Name and Exclude tabs on the Folder Properties dialog. These properties include the folder’s name, description, use of inherited and local exclude lists, and the contents of the local exclude list. If this folder is not a root folder, the working folder and alternate working folder settings are folder properties. In the case of the root folder, the working folders are view properties and not controlled by this access right.

Delete from folder

Delete this folder from the view.

Create links

Link this folder to other folders and items.

Modify links

Change the properties of a link for this folder. For example, you can change whether the link’s ends are pinned or floating, and you can change its description.

Delete links

Delete a link for this folder.

Attach/Adjust view labels

Add a view label to this folder. Move a view label from one revision of this folder to another. This right controls direct manipulation of view labels for this folder at the folder level. It does not stop users from attaching a view label to this folder when a view label has been created.

Detach view labels

Remove a view label from this folder. Be aware that, if users can delete view labels, they can detach a view label from this folder by deleting the view label from the view, regardless of the setting for this right.

Attach/Adjust revision labels

Add a revision label to this folder. Move a revision label from one revision of this folder to another. This right controls direct manipulation of view labels for this folder at the folder level.

Detach revision labels

Remove a revision label from this folder. Be aware that, if users can delete revision labels, they can detach a revision label from this folder by deleting the revision label from the view, regardless of the setting of this right.

Change folder access rights

Change the access rights for this folder. If you change this setting, be sure that your name remains on the list of users who can change access rights.

Child Folder Access Rights

See item and its properties

See the selected folder's child folders or the selected project or view's folders in the application folder hierarchy (left pane). View Name, Exclude, and Files tabs on the Folder Properties dialog for these folders.

See history

See the History tab on the Folder Properties dialog. This right applies to the selected folder's child folders or the selected project's or view's folders.

See links

See the links on the Links tab of the Folder Properties dialog. This right applies to the selected folder's child folders or the selected project's or view's folders.

Modify properties

Change the folder properties on the Name and Exclude tabs on the Folder Properties dialog for the child folders. These properties include the folder’s name, description, use of inherited and local exclude lists, and the contents of the local exclude list. If a child folder is not a root folder, the working folder and alternate working folder settings are folder properties. In the case of the root folder, the working folders are view properties and not controlled by this access right.

Delete from folder

Delete the selected folder’s child folders or the selected project's or view’s folders.

Create links

Link the selected folder’s child folders or the selected project's or view’s folders to other folders and items.

Modify links

Change the properties of a link for the selected folder’s child folders or the selected project or view’s folders. For example, you can change whether the link’s ends are pinned or floating, and you can change its description.

Delete links

Delete a link for the selected folder’s child folders or the selected project's or view’s folders.

Attach/Adjust view labels

Add a view label to the selected folder’s child folders or the selected project's or view’s folders. Move a view label from one revision of a child folder to another. This right controls direct manipulation of view labels for child folders at the folder level. It does not stop users from attaching a label to child folders when a view label is created.

Detach view labels

Remove a view label from the selected folder’s child folders or the selected project's or view’s folders. Be aware that, if users can delete view labels, they can detach a view label from child folders by deleting the view label from the view, regardless of the setting for this right.

Attach/Adjust revision labels

Add a revision label to the selected folder’s child folders or the selected project's or view’s folders. Move a revision label from one revision of a child folder to another. This right controls direct manipulation of revision labels for child folders at the folder level.

Detach revision labels

Remove a revision label from the selected folder’s child folders or the selected project's or view’s folders. Be aware that, if users can delete revision labels, they can detach a revision label from child folders by deleting the revision label from the view, regardless of the setting for this right.

Change folder access rights

Change the access rights for the selected folder’s child folders or the selected project's or view’s folders. If you change this setting, be sure that your name remains on the list of users who can change access rights.

Create folder in a view or folder

Create a folder in the parent folder, view, or project that has this option in its Folder Access Rights dialog.

Share/Move folder out of a folder

Share or move a folder in the parent folder, view, or project that has this option in its Folder Access Rights dialog.

Change behavior or configuration

Change the branching ability and configuration of folders that reside in the parent folder, view, or project that has this option in its Folder Access Rights dialog.
